Package ludoGame

Class Board

java.lang.Object
ludoGame.Board
public class Board extends Object
Responsible for drawing the primary Ludo board to the window and handling board-related logic.
Author:
Reggie Andrade

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board(double width, double height, javafx.scene.layout.Pane p)
    Creates and draws a new board object, which can be added to a window root.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(double width, double height, javafx.scene.layout.Pane p)
      Creates and draws a new board object, which can be added to a window root.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the board
      height - The height of the board
      p - Pane object, used for drawBoard()

  • Method Details

    • getCanvas

      Returns the canvas object of the board.
      Returns:
      Canvas object

    • getGraphicsContext

      public javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext getGraphicsContext()
      Returns the GraphicsContext object of the board. May be depricated.
      Returns:
      GraphicsContext object

    • getSpots

      public Spot[][] getSpots()
      Returns a two-dimensional array of all spots on the board.
      Returns:
      Spot 2D array

    • getPath

      public int[][] getPath(int team)
      Returns an array of coordinates which define the order which each team's pawn should move.
      Parameters:
      team - The team (player) path to get (1 = blue, 2 = orange, 3 = green, 4 = yellow)
      Returns:
      team path

    • getStretches

      public int[][][] getStretches()
      Get the home stretch for each team (player)
      Returns:
      The home stretches for each team (player), in order within a 3D int array

    • getHomes

      public int[][][] getHomes()
      Get the homes for each team (player)
      Returns:
      Home positions for each player, in order within a 3D int array

    • getStarts

      public int[][] getStarts()
      Get the starts for each team (player)
      Returns:
      Start positions for each player, in order within a 2D array

    • drawBoard

      public void drawBoard(javafx.scene.layout.Pane p)
      Draws all elements of the Ludo board onto the canvas. Internal use only.
      Parameters:
      p - Pane, used for
